step1.sentence: The manager worked with the team to remove obstacles that were slowing down the project.

step2.story: Sara noticed that her team kept missing deadlines because of unclear approval processes. She met with leadership to remove obstacles and streamline the workflow. Within a week, the team's productivity improved dramatically.

step3.story: When Daniel took over as project lead, the development team was struggling under a mountain of bureaucratic red tape. Every small decision required sign-offs from five different departments, bringing progress to a crawl. Daniel spent two weeks meeting with stakeholders, listening to frustrations, and identifying the root causes of the delays. His goal was simple: remove obstacles so his team could do their best work. Gradually, he streamlined the approval process and gave the team more autonomy to make day-to-day decisions. The change was remarkable — morale lifted, deadlines were met, and the project shipped ahead of schedule.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 길이나 과정에 있는 방해물이나 장애물을 없애거나 치운다는 뜻이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 주로 업무, 프로젝트, 목표 달성 과정에서 진행을 막는 문제나 걸림돌을 해결한다는 맥락으로 사용된다. 물리적 장애물뿐 아니라 관료적 절차, 의사소통 문제, 심리적 장벽 등 다양한 상황에 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'remove'는 라틴어 'removere(re- 다시 + movere 움직이다)'에서 유래해 '치우다, 없애다'는 뜻이며, 'obstacle'은 라틴어 'obstaculum(ob- 앞에 + stare 서다)'에서 비롯되어 '앞을 가로막는 것'을 의미한다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 문제를 해결한다는 것을 넘어, 누군가가 앞으로 나아갈 수 있도록 적극적으로 환경을 개선한다는 능동적이고 지원하는 뉘앙스를 담고 있다. 리더십, 팀워크, 자기계발 맥락에서 자주 등장한다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The coach's job is to remove obstacles so the athletes can focus on training.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 코치의 역할은 선수들이 훈련에 집중할 수 있도록 장애물을 제거하는 것이다.
